name: Hotel Ranga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a gigantic stuffed polar bear in the lobby, and that is the best thing about the place. The 'hot tubs' out the back were luke warm, and although the food in the restaurant turned out to be nice enough it cost an arm and a leg and a song and dance to get anything decent for the vegetarians. It is miles from anywhere, in sight of the Hekla volcano, and I would go up the wall if I had to spend more than one night here. It was ok as a place to stay, but it is not what a 'hotel' should be.
reviews.title: Adequate but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because the main aim of our trip was to try and see the Northern Lights. Instead of booking an organised tour from the UK hoping that the Lights would show, I thought I would book into a hotel that has very little light pollution and is said to be in a great area to see the Lights.This way we had several nights to try our luck. The staff will switch off the outside hotel lights and call your room to let you know when the Lights are visible, if you ask.
reviews.title: Great location and great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was cleaned daily with fresh towels. We had a double deluxe which comfortably slept four of us (two children). The bed was huge and we had a sofa bed in there too. The bathroom was a great size and the heated towel rail was brilliant for drying our hats & gloves, we also had a large radiator in the bedroom. Our room had a flat screen TV but no DVD. The staff soon rectified that. There were nice little touches such as complimentary chocolates put in our room each day.
reviews.title: Pricey but very very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outdoor hot tubs were a great addition, as was the laptop with free internet access for all guests to use. The staff were really helpful in advising or booking any tours you may wish to take. There was also a snooker/pool table which was great for the kids to use.
reviews.title: Oddly Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was excellent. Vast choice, everything you could wish for. We only dined in the restaurant on one evening, and although expensive it was really tasty. There is a room service menu, which the chef happily adapted for the children. A great help when you have fussy eaters! There are no tea and coffee making facilities in your room but the staff will bring a flask of hot water and cups if you wish to bring your own.
reviews.title: I can see why Hotel Ranga is the only 5* hotel in the South of Iceland
Heaven is a place on earth
reviews.text: The town of Hella. Well.....There is not much to say about the town, there's a gas station, a grocery store and a nice public pool with a cool waterslide. But the best thing about this town is a place called Ranga.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having spent about a week in Hotel Ranga I can say it is one of the best and nicest places I have ever been to.Period.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, wonderful location, great food!
Do not miss out on staying here!
reviews.text: In general I must say that I only made good experiences with accomodation in Iceland, but what I encountered in Hotel Ranga was just extraordinary. It is a top notch resort where all your wishes and needs are taken care of.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food was beyond real, just amazing and the rooms are comfortable, cozy and classy. No need to talk about the service, 5 stars are simply not enough to rate the efforts the team made. Expectations are not just met, they're exceeded in paramount proportions. You might be intimidated by a huge padded polar bear standing in the hallway as you enter the hotel, but as you encounter members of the staff you feel welcome and embraced all of a sudden. To me it seemed they have at least 10 Miss Iceland and Miss Poland beauty pageant contestants working for them.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, very friendly staff, great food, beautiful setting
Beautiful hotel - great place to see the Northern Lights
reviews.text: With a lot of activities and attractions close by you won't get bored outside of the hotel. With the spa and pool area you definitely won't get bored inside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I can highly recommend this fantastic place in the middle of nowhere. I can also recommend one of all the suits. The designer has made a great job. The food is incredible…..just go there.
reviews.title: Birthday surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was nice, a lot of pleasant smiles.
reviews.title: Wish I could return right now!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ranga for 2 nights on a week-long trip, and we wished we could have stayed there longer. We were upgraded to the beautiful royal suite and had a wonderful time there. The staff was super helpful booking activities by email before we even arrived and followed up on everything once we were there. The restaurant was excellent--even my husband commented on the delicious food, and he doesn't usually pay attention to what he's eating. If you stay at the Ranga, I recommend going on an ATV trip with Unnar at www.icesafari.is--we had a fantastic time with him.
reviews.title: Unforgettable !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Iceland and Hotel Ranga was the best surprise birthday gift I could receive.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is definately a 4+ hotel with excellent service, smiling faces and good food.
reviews.title: One trip isn't enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Hotel Ranga, on my 40th birthday to a very friendly and professional reception staff. To our surprise we had been upgraded to one of the amazing suites and spend the next two nights in "Africa". We were told we were upgraded because the room had not been booked out which was amazing because not all hotels will do this, although I'd like to think it was because it was my birthday :)
reviews.title: Fantastic setting, beautiful hotel, top notch service, delicious food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After relaxing for a few hours in this beautiful suite, we went to dinner in the restaurant which was such a positive experience. The wait staff provided top-notch service and were very knowledgeable about the food and wine. I had the monkfish and langoustines and my partner the lamb and langoustines and it was absolutely delicious. My partner also had the Hotel Ranga Fish Soup which was sublime. Desserts were of the same high standard.
reviews.title: Cosy, small rooms, but great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, we received some great advice from reception about where to go and what to do along the South Coast. We saw some amazing things based on their recommendation and also did a Glacier Walk at their suggestion which was fantastic.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in the middle of nowhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second night we ate from the "bar" menu in the beautiful lounge on the second floor (which far too few people use by the way as we had it all to ourselves). The bartender, who also served us our food was so helpful and deliberately non-obtrusive in making the trek up the stairs every so often to check how we were getting on. The "bar" food was of the same standard as the dining room and I took the opportunity to have some more of the delicious fish soup. I fully appreciate the fact that some people comment on how expensive Iceland is, however, I didn't find the prices drastically different from Central London. The overall bill (other than the accommodation) was just under £200 for two nights dinner (desserts and appetisers on one night), half bottle of wine, a few Gin and Tonics and a few cappuccinos; not cheap, but worth it in my opinion.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for exploring the South West of Iceland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, an excellent experience at this beautiful hotel to which I will return very soon!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel - didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whenever I think of the four days we spent at Hotel Ranga, I have a smile on my face.
reviews.title: Cozy and welcoming - a real treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The friendly staff, their happiness to be of help regarding the Norther Lights and sightseeing, the great lounge, dining room and beautiful breakfast buffet as well as the hot tubs have been described before, and I can but confirm the coziness and happy feeling of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, you will not be dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also liked the fact that free internet access, maps and books on iceland were at our disposal in the lobby.
reviews.title: northern lights trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Meal prices in the restaurant were comparable to those of good restaurants across Europe and we found the food absolutely delicious and beautifully prepared, in short, worth every penny (to compensate, we prepared our own sandwiches at lunch time).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel & Staff, Peace & Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I made ample use of the hot tubs, which contributed to making this one of the most relaxing holidays I have ever had.
reviews.title: Hot tubs with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Ranga is perfectly situated for peace and quiet, and exploring the south of Iceland. If visiting in Winter I would say a car is vital to get the most out of your time there, but driving in the winter is not for the faint-hearted and a 4x4 will certainly make life easier in the wintery conditions. The hotel itself is stunning - we stayed in the new extension and saw no evidence of the problems mentioned elsewhere. As with many hotels I have stayed in overseas there are no kettles in the rooms so you might want to take a travel one, but everything else you are likely to need is provided - the robes are a particularly nice touch for the dash to outside hot tubs! Staff were helpful and courteous without being overpowering. My only criticism, as has been mentioned elsewhere, is the food available in the restaurant which is very expensive and gourmet, and it certainly wasn't a viable choice for us to eat there every night of our stay. Room service was more suitable and of a very high standard but the range was limited. However if you don't mind a short drive (so no drinking for the driver) the cafe on the right just before entering Hella from Hotel Ranga is a very good alternative - don't be put off by appearances, the quality of the food was outstanding and the prices reasonable for Iceland.
reviews.title: A fantastic experience....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend Iceland as a holiday destination but if visiting in Winter don't forget your thermals ( we averaged -8 to -13 not counting the wind chill factor), take a travel kettle if you need your caffeine boost (and flask for when you are out and about during the day, hotel staff will fill it for you), take a bottle or 2 of wine with you if you like a drink as all alcohol is very expensive throughout the country and fit in a visit to the Blue Lagoon if you can as it is a fantastic experience and not far from the airport so can be a lovely way to end your visit before heading off for your flight home.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Brilliant Location, Lovely People.
Northern Lights
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights 14-17 December 2009, we had such a good time, and loved the location of this Hotel, there is so much to see within a few miles, a great base. The staff were brilliant, and nothing was too much bother. We had a more basic room, still lovely, warm, welcoming, and comfy, when we arrived we misunderstood the brochure and thought every room had DVD's so we took some to watch, but these are only in premium rooms, but they arranged one for us for the duration of our stay. We took our own flask and they filled it every morning and night with a smile, and gave great advice on sightseeing too. The hot tubs are filled from a geothermal spring, so they dont have much control over the temperature, but they were all working and all very hot for us and we had a great time looking at the stars and relaxing in them. There was more than adequate car park spaces, and we saw no sign of the building work some other people mentioned so we can assume its all done, it was just a perfect Hotel in the best setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on one night only as its expensive. It was a little too highbrow for our taste, although the salmon was lovely, the white chocolate sauce served with it was strange to my palatte, we dined from the set menu, expensive and incredibly small portions, in fact the 3 pieces of fish starter were ridiculously small. The one failing of this hotel is that there is no snack menu, no big bowls of warming soup, simple omlette, or cheese sandwich, its all just very expensive prententious food. It is an exclusive hotel, but there arent many exclusive hotels in the world where you cant get a hamburger :o)
reviews.title: Incomplete !
Hot tub under the stars
reviews.text: There is an excellent diner in on the main road to Hella, (the fried haddock in shrimp sauce was divine and very very fresh) which was inexpensive, another night we ate at the Pizza house in Hvolsvollur, the Pizzas were really nice and once again, a fraction of the cost of the Ranga.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good facilities, some of the staff were excellent, others were worse than awful. Food was OK but should have been better but they had very a good wine selection. Hot tub was great (if a little too public). Excursions are easy to organise through reception (fantastic staff on reception) and wifi is free. The only problem we found was sadly a big one. For a top class hotel they had only two staff waiting on at dinner and it was clear they couldn't cope and one guy was very rude to us, he practically threw my dinner plate on the table. We thought we'd done something to offend him. They also had a policy of keeping your dinner wine away from your table. This is OK if you get a good waiter/waitress, but if not, you will never get your glass refilled. When I did ask for my glass to be refilled I had the feeling I was seen as an alcoholic and after having my dinner delivered in a an aggressive manor, I must admit, I was very upset by this and it ruined my experience of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, service very changeable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't believe in complaining at hotels, why should put myself in an uncomfortable position because the service is bad. I usually chose to make it anonymously via trip advisor and never return.
reviews.title: Nice countryside hotel with the best food, excellent service and beautiful rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: If the hotel management are reading this the rude waiter was in his mid 30s and wearing a suit on waiting on the 28th May 2009.
reviews.title: Out of this world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic lodging with a view of the excotic Icelandic nature. Short distance to many extrordinary sightseeings like the vulcano Hekla, the hot geysers, beautiful waterfalls, glaciers and the highlands which all are must sees if you're visiting this remarkable island. I spent a week at Rangá and recomend that as a minimum! So much to see!!
reviews.title: fantastic romantic spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed one night at their sister hotel, Highland, the nature reminds of something out of this planet, I heard a story about NASA testing their moonmobiles right here because of the rough environment.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in a magical country.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Hotel Ranga for a long weekend and had a fabulous time. The rooms were lovely, very comfortable with hot tubs just outside the rooms overlooking the river. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the food was great and it was lovely to have views of the surrounding area from the restaurant as it was all glass. We stayed during the snowstorms and it was stunning. We would recommend staying here to anyone, but don't expect cheap prices in the restaurant as it is A la carte so nothing is basic food. Breakfast is well catered for with plenty to choose from.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights at the end of February and had an amazing time. We'd booked into a deluxe room but were upgraded to a suite which was huge with gorgeous views across the river. We were really lucky and saw the Northern Lights both nights. Being in the middle of nowhere definitely helped and the hotel manager is an expert at interpreting the forecasts, he's also really helpful for planning days out. This hotel is great if you want to get away from it all. It's really remote and there is absolutely nothing around but that's the best thing about it. The drive east to Vik is stunning and well worth a day exploring. The only slight downside is the restaurant food which is very expensive even by Iceland standards. After just two nights we felt totally relaxed.
reviews.title: Amazing remote location, perfect getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything about Hotel Ranga was perfect, from the stunning location to the kind staff, they really did make our wedding day at nearby Oddi Church utterly magical. We now cannot wait to return, every anniversary if we could!! There is so much to see and do, the outdoor hot tubs were divine, the food was gorgeous, the rooms were so comfortable, and the suite was out of this world! Thanks again to everyone there! Sarah & Ben Thomson x x x
reviews.title: Our Wedding at Hotel Ranga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just come back from a family post-Christmas break in Iceland for 5 nights.
reviews.title: A paradise in the south western coast of Iceland

likes.liked: — High quality accommodation and very good food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending 3 nights in Reykjavik, we took a public bus to Hella.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - handy location

likes.disliked: — views not as spectacular as other hotels, though still nice,

description: Hotel Ranga is a luxury countryside hotel and the only 4 star resort in South Iceland. It offers all the facilities and services of a modern resort. Located about an hour from Reykjavík between the towns of Hella and Hvolsvöllur, it lies just off the main road right in middle of South Iceland’s panoramic scenery. The resort is built in log-cabin style and has through the years acquired an excellent reputation for its food, accomodation and service. It is the first Icelandic hotel to become a member of the prestigious international hotel chain Great Hotels of the World. A celebrity hot spot, top honeymoon destination and favorite hotel amongst Icelanders, Hotel Rangá also offers great facilities for small business meetings, weddings and social gatherings. One cannot miss feeling welcome entering its warm interior where relaxed countryside feeling meets the professional ambition of pleasing its entire clientel. Upon entering Hotel Ranga, you will be greeted by a towering 10-foot tall polar bear named Hrammur that resides in the lobby. He is a favorite model for photographers and is definitely one of the most pictured objects in Iceland. This is just a prelude to the cozy ambience that you will encounter that vibrates throughout the hotel. Hótel Rangá was upgraded and renovated in 2007/2008 and presently has 51 luxuriously decorated rooms and suites. It also features an acclaimed riverside restaurant, a lounge and bar, 2 upstairs meeting rooms, a game room, massage facilities and three much beloved outdoor hot tubs heated with geothermal water - where there is an excellent chance to view the fantastic northern lights during September through April.
